alert.note: Alert for Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 4:59AM PDT until November 05 at 1:39PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Puyallup River Near Orting affecting Pierce County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain ended over the area late Friday. No hydrologically significant rain is forecast for the weekend. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Puyallup River Near Orting. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10,000 cfs, the Puyallup river will flood low lying areas near Orting and along the upper reaches, including along Orville Road East south of Brooks Road, Neadham Road, and the vicinity of the County Subdivision/Tomolla Farm. High flows will also increase the threat of channel migration and bank erosion. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 AM PDT Saturday the flow was 12,200 cfs. - Recent Activity...The river crested near 15,900 cfs around 915 PM PDT Friday. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early this morning and continue falling this afternoon. - Flood flow is 10,000 cfs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
